{"text":"Prompt:

Design a mobile-first “While You Charge” discovery page for Nerava, the Moment of Charge Discovery Network.

Context

The user is actively charging their EV. This is a constrained, time-based moment.
The UI should feel calm, confident, and authoritative — not exploratory or overwhelming.

This is not a map-first experience. The goal is to help the driver quickly decide what to do during or immediately after charging.

⸻

Page Structure (Top to Bottom)

1. Status Header (Persistent)
	•	Dark background, premium feel
	•	Left: NERAVA⚡ logo
	•	Right: small status label:
	•	“Charging Active”
	•	This should feel system-level, like Wallet / Apple UI

⸻

2. Moment Header
Centered copy block:
	•	Large headline:
“You’re Charging.”
	•	Subheadline:
“Here’s what’s nearby.”
	•	Supporting line (muted):
“Places that fit the charging moment.”

Avoid language like “verification” or “tracking”.

⸻

3. Featured Merchant Card (Hero)
One large, edge-to-edge rounded card:
	•	High-quality interior or product photo
	•	Merchant name (e.g. Austin Java)
	•	Category (Coffee • Bakery)
	•	Left badge:
	•	Green pill: “3 min walk” OR “Easy stop after charging”
	•	Right badge:
	•	Lightning icon + text:
“Featured while you charge”
	•	Card should feel intentional and sponsored, not ad-like

This is the primary decision surface.

⸻

4. Nearby Options Grid
Two smaller cards side-by-side:
	•	Merchant image
	•	Name
	•	Single green pill:
	•	“4 min walk”
	•	“5 min walk”
	•	OR “On your way out”
	•	Keep copy minimal — recognition over explanation

These are supporting options, not infinite scroll.

⸻

5. Primary Action (Bottom)
Large rounded button:
	•	Text:
“Ask Nerava”
	•	Subtext (optional, small):
“Tell me what fits my charge”

This replaces “View more”.
It signals delegation, not browsing.

⸻

Visual Style
	•	iOS-native feel (Wallet / Maps inspired)
	•	Soft shadows, rounded corners
	•	Dark + neutral palette with green accents
	•	No clutter, no ads, no dense text
	•	Typography should feel system-level, trustworthy

⸻

UX Principles (Important)
	•	No maps
	•	No long lists
	•	No infinite scroll
	•	Everything should feel scoped to right now
	•	This is a decision page, not a discovery feed

⸻

Deliverable

Produce:
	•	A single mobile screen (iPhone size)
	•	Clean Auto Layout
	•	Reusable card components
	•	Ready for handoff to engineering"}

{"text":"I'll create a mobile-first \"While You Charge\" discovery page for Nerava with a calm, iOS-native aesthetic that emphasizes quick decision-making over exploration.\n\nLet me start by building the reusable components and main interface:","textMode":"visible_message"}

{"text":"The user wants me to design a mobile-first "While You Charge" discovery page for Nerava. Let me break down the requirements:

1. Status Header - dark background with logo and "Charging Active" status
2. Moment Header - centered copy with headline and subheadline
3. Featured Merchant Card - large hero card with image, merchant info, and badges
4. Nearby Options Grid - two smaller cards side-by-side
5. Primary Action - bottom button "Ask Nerava"

Visual Style:
- iOS-native feel (Wallet/Maps inspired)
- Dark + neutral palette with green accents
- Soft shadows, rounded corners
- Clean, minimal, trustworthy

This is a pure frontend task - no backend needed. I should:
1. Create the main App.tsx file
2. Create reusable components for the cards
3. Use Unsplash for high-quality images
4. Use lucide-react for icons
5. Follow the mobile-first, iOS-inspired design aesthetic

Let me start by creating the structure and components.","signature":""}

{"text":"Perfect! I've created a clean, iOS-native inspired \"While You Charge\" discovery page for Nerava. The interface features a premium dark design with a persistent charging status header, centered moment messaging, a hero featured merchant card with location and sponsorship badges, two nearby merchant options in a grid layout, and a bottom action button that delegates to Nerava's intelligence rather than overwhelming the user with endless scrolling.\n\nThe design emphasizes calm decision-making with soft shadows, rounded corners, green accent colors, and a mobile-first approach (max 448px wide container). All components are reusable and ready for engineering handoff.","textMode":"visible_message"}

{"text":"Figma Edit Prompt:

Make the following precise edits to the existing “While You Charge” mobile screen design. Do not redesign the layout. Modify only what is specified.

Copy & Layout Changes
	1.	Remove the line
	•	“Places that fit the charging moment.”
	•	Close the vertical gap so the hero card moves slightly upward.
	•	Keep the headline hierarchy clean and centered.
	2.	Merchant Card Enhancement
	•	On the same row as the merchant name (“Austin Java”):
	•	Add a right-aligned badge with text:
“Happy Hour ⭐️”
	•	Style:
	•	Subtle pill or text badge
	•	Warm accent (gold or soft yellow star)
	•	Should feel like a perk, not an ad
	•	Ensure the merchant name remains visually dominant.
	3.	Primary Action Change
	•	Replace the bottom CTA text:
	•	From: “Ask Nerava”
	•	To: “View More”
	•	Subtext should be removed.
	•	Button should remain visually prominent but feel secondary to the featured merchant.

⸻

Interaction Constraint (Important)
	•	Adjust spacing so that:
	•	The full experience (header, featured card, two supporting cards, CTA)
	•	Fits entirely within one mobile viewport
	•	No scrolling occurs on initial load
	•	Scrolling should only begin after tapping “View More”

⸻

Design Intent Reminder
	•	This screen represents a curated charging moment
	•	It should feel finite, confident, and intentional
	•	Avoid feed-like or infinite-scroll patterns"}

compression.summaryText:
## Background
I'm building a mobile-first "While You Charge" discovery page for Nerava, the Moment of Charge Discovery Network, designed for EV drivers actively charging their vehicles. The page needs to feel calm, confident, and authoritative with an iOS-native aesthetic (Wallet/Maps inspired) using dark backgrounds, soft shadows, rounded corners, and green accents. This is not a map-first experience but rather a curated decision page that helps drivers quickly choose what to do during their charging session. The layout includes a persistent status header, moment messaging, one featured merchant card, two nearby options in a grid, and a primary action button, all designed to fit within one mobile viewport without scrolling.

## Current state
I've implemented the complete mobile interface with reusable React components including the main App.tsx, FeaturedMerchantCard.tsx, and NearbyMerchantCard.tsx. The design features Austin Java as the featured merchant with a "Happy Hour ⭐️" badge, proper spacing to fit everything in one viewport, and the final copy reads "Here's what to do nearby" with a "View More" CTA button.

{"text":"Figma Edit Prompt:

Apply the following visual and copy edits to the existing “While You Charge” mobile screen. Do not change layout, hierarchy, or component structure unless explicitly stated.

⸻

1. Copy Refinement (Header)

Update the subheadline text:
	•	Replace:
“Here’s what to do nearby.”
	•	With:
“Here’s what fits your charge.”

Keep typography weight and alignment the same.

⸻

2. Featured Badge Copy

Update the featured merchant badge text:
	•	Replace:
“Featured”
	•	With:
“Featured while you charge”

Ensure this badge remains visually subordinate to the merchant name.

⸻

3. Color System Update (Critical)

Convert the UI from dark mode with green accents to a light mode with blue accents, following these rules:

Backgrounds
	•	App background: #FFFFFF
	•	Cards: #F7F8FA
	•	Card borders: subtle #E4E6EB

Primary Accent (Facebook Blue)
	•	Use #1877F2 for:
	•	“Charging Active” status pill
	•	Primary CTA (“Ask Nerava” / “View More”)
	•	Featured badge icon/accent
	•	Walk / “On your way out” pills (outline or soft fill)

Replace Green → Blue
	•	All green pills (“3 min walk”, “On your way out”) → blue variants
	•	Use soft blue fills or blue outlines — do not oversaturate

Text
	•	Primary text: #050505
	•	Secondary text: #65676B
	•	Avoid pure black backgrounds entirely

⸻

4. Status Header Update
	•	Header background: white
	•	“NERAVA⚡” logo in black or dark gray
	•	“Charging Active” pill:
	•	White text
	•	Blue outline or soft blue fill
	•	Should feel system-level, not promotional

⸻

5. Visual Tone

The final design should feel:
	•	Calm
	•	Official
	•	Platform-like
	•	Comparable to Wallet / Facebook / Google system UIs

Avoid:
	•	gradients
	•	glow effects
	•	playful colors
	•	dark sections

⸻

6. Output Requirements
	•	Preserve current spacing and no-scroll behavior
	•	Maintain component reusability
	•	Ensure the screen still fits fully within one mobile viewport"}

compression.summaryText:
## Background
I'm building a mobile-first "While You Charge" discovery page for Nerava, the Moment of Charge Discovery Network, designed for EV drivers actively charging their vehicles. The page needs to feel calm, confident, and authoritative with an iOS-native aesthetic (Wallet/Maps inspired) using dark backgrounds, soft shadows, rounded corners, and green accents. This is not a map-first experience but rather a curated decision page that helps drivers quickly choose what to do during their charging session. The layout includes a persistent status header, moment messaging, one featured merchant card, two nearby options in a grid, and a primary action button, all designed to fit within one mobile viewport without scrolling.

## Current state

{"text":"Figma Edit Prompt:

Refine this Merchant Details screen to align with Nerava’s Moment of Charge experience. Do not redesign the page. Adjust content, hierarchy, and actions as specified below.

⸻

1. Reframe the Purpose of the Page

This page should help the user commit to going now, not browse.

⸻

2. Add Primary Action: Wallet

Insert a prominent primary button directly below the “Happy Hour ⭐️” badge:
	•	Button text:
“Add to Wallet”
	•	Style:
	•	Facebook Blue (#1877F2)
	•	White text
	•	Full-width
	•	Rounded corners
	•	This should be the most visually dominant CTA on the page.

⸻

3. Secondary Actions
	•	Keep “Get Directions” as a secondary button below “Add to Wallet”
	•	Reduce its visual weight (outline or neutral style)
	•	Remove or hide “View Menu”

⸻

4. Content Simplification
	•	Remove the entire “Popular with EV drivers” card
	•	Collapse the “About” section into a smaller expandable section or reduce it to 2 lines
	•	The page should feel scannable in under 5 seconds

⸻

5. Distance & Timing Framing (Keep + Slight Polish)

Keep the distance card but refine copy to emphasize the moment:
	•	Example:
“0.2 miles · Fits your charge window”

Avoid language like “nearby” or “explore”.

⸻

6. Visual Hierarchy Check

Ensure the following order of attention:
	1.	Merchant name
	2.	Happy Hour ⭐️
	3.	Add to Wallet
	4.	Distance / timing
	5.	Get Directions

Nothing else should compete visually.

⸻

7. Design Tone
	•	This is access, not a deal
	•	This is activation, not discovery
	•	Clean, calm, system-like
	•	Comparable to Apple Wallet or boarding pass confirmation screens

⸻

8. Prototype Interaction (Optional)

If possible:

compression.summaryText:
## Background
I'm building a mobile-first "While You Charge" discovery page for Nerava, the Moment of Charge Discovery Network, designed for EV drivers actively charging their vehicles. The page needs to feel calm, confident, and authoritative with an iOS-native aesthetic (Wallet/Maps inspired) using light backgrounds, soft shadows, rounded corners, and Facebook blue (#1877F2) accents. This is not a map-first experience but rather a curated decision page that helps drivers quickly choose what to do during their charging session, with the layout including a persistent status header, moment messaging, one featured merchant card, two nearby options in a grid, and a primary action button, all designed to fit within one mobile viewport without scrolling. The design was recently converted from dark mode with green accents to light mode with Facebook blue accents, with copy updates including "Here's what fits your charge" and "Featured while you charge" badge text.

## Current state
I've implemented the complete mobile interface with the main discovery page and added a merchant detail page that appears when clicking on merchant cards. The merchant detail page focuses on commitment and activation rather than browsing, featuring "Add to Wallet for Happy Hour access" as the primary CTA, with simplified content and clear visual hierarchy that feels like Apple Wallet confirmation screens.

{"text":"Figma AI Prompt — Wallet Added Confirmation

Copy-paste this into Figma AI → Edit design while selecting the Merchant Details frame.

⸻

Figma Edit Prompt:

Add a Wallet success confirmation overlay that appears immediately after tapping “Add to Wallet.”

This overlay should confirm access and reinforce trust, not celebrate.

⸻

Overlay Behavior
	•	Presentation:
	•	Modal overlay or bottom sheet
	•	Dims background slightly
	•	Keeps merchant context visible
	•	Trigger:
	•	Appears on tap of “Add to Wallet”
	•	Dismiss:
	•	“Done” button
	•	OR swipe down (if bottom sheet)

⸻

Content (Top to Bottom)

1. Status Icon
	•	Wallet icon or checkmark
	•	Facebook Blue (#1877F2)
	•	Medium size, centered
	•	No animation required

⸻

2. Headline
“Added to Wallet”
	•	Bold
	•	Neutral tone
	•	No exclamation marks

⸻

3. Subtext (Important)
Use this exact framing or close to it:

“This pass is active while you’re charging.”

Optional second line (smaller):
“Show it at Austin Java to access Happy Hour.”

This reinforces:
	•	time-bounded access
	•	real-world use
	•	merchant recognition

⸻

4. Merchant Context Card (Compact)
A small confirmation card showing:
	•	Merchant name: Austin Java
	•	Badge: Happy Hour ⭐️
	•	Timing note:
	•	“Active for ~45 min”
	•	or “Active while charging”

This makes it feel real, not abstract.

⸻

5. Primary Action
Button:
	•	Text: “Done”
	•	Style:
	•	Facebook Blue fill
	•	White text
	•	Rounded
	•	Action:
	•	Closes overlay
	•	Returns user to previous screen

⸻

Visual Tone
	•	White background
	•	Soft shadow
	•	Clean spacing
	•	System-like (Apple Wallet inspiration)
	•	No emojis
	•	No celebration language

⸻

Prototype Wiring (Optional)
	•	“Add to Wallet” → opens overlay
	•	“Done” → closes overlay
	•	Keep interaction instant"}

{"text":"I see you've prepared a detailed Figma AI prompt for the Wallet confirmation overlay! This is a great addition that will reinforce the commitment moment and provide clear feedback to users.

The design approach is excellent:
